intro: Knautia subscaposa, commonly known as the lesser knautia, is a flowering plant native to central and southern Europe. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and typically grows in meadows and rocky habitats. The plant features slender, erect stems with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and range in color from pink to purple. It blooms in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
